member.name: T:Aspose.Font.BuildVersionInfo
member.summary: Provides information about the current product name and version.
member.example:
Shows how to use BuildVersionInfo to display version information about this product.
Console.WriteLine("I am currently using {0}, version number {1}!", BuildVersionInfo.Product, BuildVersionInfo.Version);

member.name: P:Aspose.Font.FontEnvironment.Strictness
member.summary:
Some Fonts may contain unexpected data, non-specified features, or may be roughly cropped.
Tolerant setting is recommended for consumers who want to open any font regardless possible Font's inadequacy. Font internal structures are not guaranteed to be consistent. Strict setting is recommended for consumers who want to open mostly valid and solid Fonts.

member.name: T:Aspose.Font.TransformationMatrix
member.summary:
Represents 3x3 transformation matrix | A B 0 | | C D 0 | | TX TY 1 |.
Transforms coordinates in the following way: x1 = A*x + C*y + TX; y1 = B*x + D*y + TY.

member.summary: Gets or sets A transformation matrix value.

member.summary: Gets or sets TX transformation matrix value.

member.summary: Gets or sets TY transformation matrix value.

member.summary: Creates standard 1 to 1 transformation matrix: [ A B C D TX TY ] = [ 1, 0, 0, 1, 0, 0].

member.summary: Accepts a transformation matrix with following array representation: [ A B C D TX TY ].

member.summary: Transforms back x1 and y1 and returns x and y before the transformation matrix.

member.summary: Scales back x1 and y1 and returns x and y before the transformation matrix.

member.summary: Defines an interface for Font encoding.

member.name: M:Aspose.Font.IFontEncoding.GidToUnicode(Aspose.Font.Glyphs.GlyphId)
member.summary: Decodes Gid to unicode. Glyph id is a unique number for a glyph, which is font type dependent. For example: Type1's id is a glyph name, instance of () class. TTF's id is an int index, instance of () class.
member.param: Glyph identifier of symbol to decode.
member.returns: Unicode value related to glyph id passed.

member.name: M:Aspose.Font.IFontEncoding.Encode(System.UInt32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Encodes the glyph. For TTF Fonts the charCode is unicode.
member.param: Character code associated with the glyph id.

member.name: M:Aspose.Font.IFontEncoding.UnicodeToGid(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Decodes a unicode and returns glyph id. Glyph id is a unique number for a glyph, which is font type dependent. For example: Type1's id is a glyph name, instance of () class. TTF's id is an int index, instance of () class.
member.param: Unicode to get glyph identifier for.
member.returns: Glyph identifier related to unicode passed.

member.name: M:Aspose.Font.IFontEncoding.DecodeToGid(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Decodes a character code and returns glyph id. Glyph id is a unique number for a glyph, which is font type dependent. For example: Type1's id is a glyph name, instance of () class. TTF's id is an int index, instance of () class. Note: character code is not necessary a unicode. Character code is a char index in Font encoding "table".
member.param: Character code to get glyph identifier for.
member.returns: Glyph identifier related to charCode passed.

member.name: M:Aspose.Font.IFontEncoding.DecodeToGidParameterized(Aspose.Font.IEncodingParameters,System.UInt32)
member.summary:
Parameterized decode method.
Some font types can have multiple encoding algorithms/maps. So, interface is used to create concrete font encoding parameters.
member.param: Character code to get glyph identifier for.
member.returns: Glyph identifier related to char code passed.

member.name: P:Aspose.Font.License.Embedded
member.summary: License number was added as embedded resource.

member.name: M:Aspose.Font.License.SetLicense(System.String)

remarks.p: Tries to find the license in the following locations:
2. The folder that contains the Aspose component assembly.
3. The folder that contains the client's calling assembly.
4. The folder that contains the entry (startup) assembly.
5. An embedded resource in the client's calling assembly.
Note:On the .NET Compact Framework, tries to find the license only in these locations:
2. An embedded resource in the client's calling assembly.

member.param: Can be a full or short file name or name of an embedded resource. Use an empty string to switch to evaluation mode.

member.name: M:Aspose.Font.License.SetLicense(System.IO.Stream)
member.param: A stream that contains the license.

remarks.p: Use this method to load a license from a stream.

member.summary: Renders glyph using independent glyph path. RenderGlyph() function family changes glyph path on rendering. It then leads to necessity reload this glyph again. This function uses copy of glyph path and doesn't changes original glyph path, so the same glyph could be reused multiple times. This version of function is intended for use with cache of glyphs.

Matrix that is applied to glyph coordinates.

member.summary: In hmtx table could be the cases when total number of glyphs is not equal to hhea.numberOfHMetrics. For these cases hmtx table contains additional array 'leftSideBearing' which is correspondent to property . But glyphs with indexes from hhea.numOfLongHorMetrics to maxp.numGlyphs also have widths. And these widths in accordance to specification for hmtx table have such values: "Here the advanceWidth is assumed to be the same as the advanceWidth for the last entry above".

member.param: Name identifier, logical string category, specified by enumeration
New name or new string data

member.name: M:Aspose.Font.TtfTables.TtfNameTable.UpdateNamesByNameId(Aspose.Font.TtfTables.TtfNameTable.NameId,System.String)
member.summary: Selects all records which related to logical string category, specified by parameter nameId and updates name field (string data) in these records. Fields related to platform (platformID, Platform-specific encoding ID) and language (Language ID) are not affected by this method. Only name string data is replaced with a new name. Use this method with caution, cause it will replace original names for all platforms and languages, related to nameId. It can make a conflicts for cases when original names had different values, cause replace operation changes all these values with new single one.And this new value may have a logical inconsistency with some platforms and languages. This method is useful for cases when original name has single representation for all platforms and languages, for example, when name string data is in english language.
member.param: Name identifier, logical string category, specified by enumeration
New name or new string data

member.name: M:Aspose.Font.TtfTables.TtfNameTable.AddMultiLanguageNames(Aspose.Font.MultiLanguageString,Aspose.Font.TtfTables.TtfNameTable.PlatformId,System.UInt16,Aspose.Font.TtfTables.TtfNameTable.NameId)
member.summary: Extracts all multilingual strings from passed object and creates correspondent NameRecord structure for every string extracted using passed parameters , and . Value for field languageID is extracted from object. New just created record is added into table. If record which coincides with just created by fields platformID, platformSpecificID, nameID and, langugeId will be found, then new created record will not be added and only string data will be updated for existing record.
member.param: Name identifier, logical string category, specified by enumeration

member.summary: Returns a name as object of type . Method collects all NameRecord structures which coincide with passed parameters nameId, platformId and platformSpecificId and then builds resultant object based on this structures list.

member.summary: String in the string storage related to this name record.

member.name: F:Aspose.Font.TtfTables.TtfNameTable.NameId.FontFamily
member.summary: 1 Font Family. This string is the Font family name the user sees on Macintosh platforms.

member.name: F:Aspose.Font.TtfTables.TtfNameTable.NameId.FontSubfamily
member.summary: 2 Font Subfamily. This string is the Font family the user sees on Macintosh platforms.

member.name: F:Aspose.Font.TtfTables.TtfNameTable.NameId.UniqueFontId
member.summary: 3 Unique subfamily identification (Apple spec). 3 Unique Font identifier (MS spec).

member.name: F:Aspose.Font.TtfTables.TtfNameTable.NameId.PostScriptName
member.summary: 6 PostScript name of the Font. Note: A Font may have only one PostScript name and that name must be ASCII.

member.name: F:Aspose.Font.TtfTables.TtfNameTable.NameId.DesignerName
member.summary: 9 Designer; name of the designer of the typeface.

member.name: F:Aspose.Font.TtfTables.TtfNameTable.NameId.Description
member.summary: 10 Description; description of the typeface. Can contain revision information, usage recommendations, history, features, and so on.

member.name: F:Aspose.Font.TtfTables.TtfNameTable.NameId.UrlVendor
member.summary: 11 URL of the Font vendor (with procotol, e.g., http://, ftp://). If a unique serial number is embedded in the URL, it can be used to register the Font.

member.name: F:Aspose.Font.TtfTables.TtfNameTable.NameId.UrlDesigner
member.summary: 12 URL of the Font designer (with protocol, e.g., http://, ftp://)

member.name: F:Aspose.Font.TtfTables.TtfNameTable.NameId.LicenseDescription
member.summary: 13 License description; description of how the Font may be legally used, or different example scenarios for licensed use. This field should be written in plain language, not legalese.

member.name: F:Aspose.Font.TtfTables.TtfNameTable.NameId.LicenseInfoUrl
member.summary: 14 License information URL, where additional licensing information can be found.

member.name: F:Aspose.Font.TtfTables.TtfNameTable.NameId.PreferredFamily
member.summary: 15 Reserved 16 Preferred Family (Windows only); In Windows, the Family name is displayed in the Font menu; the Subfamily name is presented as the Style name. For historical reasons, Font families have contained a maximum of four styles, but Font designers may group more than four fonts to a single family. The Preferred Family and Preferred Subfamily IDs allow Font designers to include the preferred family/subfamily groupings. These IDs are only present if they are different from IDs 1 and 2.

member.name: F:Aspose.Font.TtfTables.TtfNameTable.NameId.PreferredSubfamily
member.summary: 17 Preferred Subfamily (Windows only); In Windows, the Family name is displayed in the Font menu; the Subfamily name is presented as the Style name. For historical reasons, Font families have contained a maximum of four styles, but Font designers may group more than four fonts to a single family. The Preferred Family and Preferred Subfamily IDs allow Font designers to include the preferred family/subfamily groupings. These IDs are only present if they are different from IDs 1 and 2.

member.name: F:Aspose.Font.TtfTables.TtfNameTable.NameId.CompatibleFull
member.summary: 18 Compatible Full (Macintosh only); On the Macintosh, the menu name is constructed using the Font resource. This usually matches the Full Name. If you want the name of the Font to appear differently than the Full Name, you can insert the Compatible Full Name in ID 18. This name is not used by the Mac OS itself, but may be used by application developers (e.g., Adobe).

member.name: F:Aspose.Font.TtfTables.TtfNameTable.NameId.SampleText
member.summary: 19 Sample text. This can be the Font name, or any other text that the designer thinks is the best sample text to show what the Font looks like.

member.name: F:Aspose.Font.TtfTables.TtfNameTable.NameId.PostScriptCID
member.summary: Its presence in a font means that the nameID 6 holds a PostScript font name that is meant to be used with the composefont invocation in order to invoke the font in a PostScript interpreter

member.name: F:Aspose.Font.TtfTables.TtfNameTable.NameId.WwsFamilyName
member.summary: Used to provide a WWS-conformant family name in case the entries for IDs 16 and 17 do not conform to the WWS model

member.name: F:Aspose.Font.TtfTables.TtfNameTable.NameId.WwsSubfamilyName
member.summary: Used in conjunction with ID 21, this ID provides a WWS-conformant subfamily name (reflecting only weight, width and slope attributes) in case the entries for IDs 16 and 17 do not conform to the WWS model

member.name: F:Aspose.Font.TtfTables.TtfNameTable.NameId.LightBackground

member.name: F:Aspose.Font.TtfTables.TtfNameTable.NameId.DarkBackground

member.name: F:Aspose.Font.TtfTables.TtfNameTable.NameId.VariationsPostScriptNamePrefix

member.summary: This parameter is a classification of font-family design. The font class and font subclass are registered values assigned by IBM to each font family. This parameter is intended for use in selecting an alternate font when the requested font is not available.

member.name: P:Aspose.Font.TtfTables.TtfOs2Table.Panose
member.summary: This 10 byte series of numbers is used to describe the visual characteristics of a given typeface. These characteristics are then used to associate the font with other fonts of similar appearance having different names.

member.name: P:Aspose.Font.TtfTables.TtfOs2Table.FSSelection
member.summary:
Contains information concerning the nature of the font patterns.
0 bit 1 ITALIC Font contains Italic characters, otherwise they are upright. 1 UNDERSCORE Characters are underscored. 2 NEGATIVE Characters have their foreground and background reversed. 3 OUTLINED Outline (hollow) characters, otherwise they are solid. 4 STRIKEOUT Characters are overstruck. 5 bit 0 BOLD Characters are emboldened. 6 REGULAR Characters are in the standard weight/style for the Font.

member.name: P:Aspose.Font.TtfCommon.Version16Dot16.MajorNumber
member.summary: Gets or sets major version number. Value has sense only in hexademical notation, for example version 0.5 for 'maxp' in actual font files is 4 bytes: {0, 0, 80, 0}, what has hexademical representation 0x00005000. After reading this version from font file, Major and minor numbers for object will be 0 and 20480 respectively. And these values in hexademical form are 0x0000 and 0x5000.

member.name: P:Aspose.Font.TtfCommon.Version16Dot16.MinorNumber
member.summary: Gets or sets minor version number Value has sense only in hexademical notation, for example version 0.5 for 'maxp' in actual font files is 4 bytes: {0, 0, 80, 0}, what has hexademical representation 0x00005000. After reading this version from font file, Major and minor numbers for object will be 0 and 20480 respectively. And these values in hexademical form are 0x0000 and 0x5000.

member.name: P:Aspose.Font.TtfCommon.Version16Dot16.RawBytes
member.summary: Gets all raw bits for Version16Dot16 version number as byte array with size 4 bytes.

members.member: Return version value as a formated string For example "0.5", "1.1", "3.0" etc. 1 Object of type

member.name: T:Aspose.Font.TtfHelpers.IFontCharactersMerger
member.summary: Declares helpers functionality to merge TrueType fonts. Font which is passed by parameter font1 considered as primary. It means that many characteristics, related to final merged font, such as metrics, encoding structure and others, will be taken from this primary font.

member.name: M:Aspose.Font.TtfHelpers.IFontCharactersMerger.MergeFonts(Aspose.Font.Glyphs.GlyphId[],Aspose.Font.Glyphs.GlyphId[],System.String)
member.summary: Merges fonts based on glyphs lists passed. Searches for a character code for every glyph passed and add found character code with correspondent glyph into resultant new font.
member.param: List of glyphs from first font
List of glyphs from second font

member.name: M:Aspose.Font.TtfHelpers.IFontCharactersMerger.MergeFonts(System.UInt32[],System.UInt32[],System.String)
member.summary: Merges fonts based on character codes lists passed. To create desired resultant font just pass symbol codes from original fonts you want to include into resultant font. Glyphs related to codes passed will be found automatically. For example, if you want to include into resultant font glyphs related to letters A and B from first font and glyphs, related to letters C and D from second font, just call this method like this: MergeFonts(new uint[] { 'A', 'B' }, new uint[] { 'C', 'D' }, "NewFont")
member.param: Codes to take from first font
Codes to take from second font

member.name: M:Aspose.Font.TtfHelpers.IFontCharactersMerger.MergeFonts(System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.UInt32,Aspose.Font.Glyphs.GlyphId},System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.UInt32,Aspose.Font.Glyphs.GlyphId},System.String)
member.summary: This method version designed for cases when you want to set character codes for glyphs in resultant font explicitly. It's not mandatory that code for glyph you provided is included in original font. The sense of code passed is that it will be associated with correspondent glyph identifier in resultant font. So, rule to process every pair passed by dictionary parameter[code, glyph ideitifier] is that only glyph identifer will be taken from original font and then it will be linked with correspondent code in resultant font. It can be helpful when some codes from first font conflict with same codes from second font.
member.param: Dictionary with pairs [symbol code, glyph identifier] from first font
Dictionary with pairs [symbol code, glyph identifier] from second font
